IBM is a leading technology company seeking a Product Manager Intern for 2026. In this role, you will assist with projects across the cloud portfolio, focusing on product management process agility and optimization while collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive efficiency in product management processes.


Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with the broader IBM product organization to help support the portfolio and business
  • Become an expert in IBMâ€™s product management methodologies, design thinking and new product introduction. Support product teams in defining product requirements, user stories, and specifications
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, design, marketing, and sales) to ensure timely product delivery
  • Analyze competitors, market trends and customer feedback to identify new product opportunities

Skills

  • Pursuing a Bachelors or master's in computer science or computer engineering or any related field in Product Management
  • Experience in Product Management or equivalent practical experience building or deploying products in a Cloud based software organization
  • Experience in implementing agile practices and design thinking
  • Strong written communication and presentation skills
  • Problem solving and Business Analysis skills
  • Ability to work 3 days a week from the office
  • Track record of high-quality, self-directed, timely execution
  • Attention to detail
  • Technical expertise and ability to communicate, work & build trust with stakeholders
  • Experience with Cloud & technology

Company Overview

  • IBM is an IT technology and consulting firm providing computer hardware, software, infrastructure, and hosting services. It was founded in 1911, and is headquartered in Armonk, New York, USA, with a workforce of 10001+ employees. Its website is http://www.ibm.com.

    • Company H1B Sponsorship

  • IBM has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships, with 3032 in 2025, 3301 in 2024, 2160 in 2023, 1809 in 2022, 1157 in 2021, 2669 in 2020. Please note that this does not guarantee sponsorship for this specific role.
